benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to invoice item

covered: PUT Valid Request coverage: TC01-TC05 verify successful updates of custom fields for an existing invoice item with valid payloads and header variations (required and optional headers).
Non-Existing Resource coverage: TC07 confirms 404 for non-existent invoice item (and TC24/TC25 explore state when items are missing).

Validation & Error Handling: TC06 (invalid id format), TC08 (malformed JSON), TC09 (missing required header), TC10 (empty body), TC11 (unsupported fields), TC12 (large payload with 413 possibility), TC14 (SQL injection payloads) demonstrate robust input validation and error responses.
Authorization coverage: TC13 tests 401 for invalid/missing authentication.
Server/Dependency Errors: TC15 (500), TC16 (504), TC19 (503) cover internal/server dependency failures and gateway timeout scenarios.
Data integrity & regression: TC04/TC05 cover updates with/without prior custom fields; TC18 regression scenario ensures no data loss or corruption.
Idempotency: TC17 validates repeated PUTs return 204 and maintain consistency.
Edge cases & boundaries: TC22 (minimum values), TC23 (extra URL parameters), TC24/TC25 state variations cover boundary conditions and mismatch scenarios.
Performance: TC20 (parallel updates) and TC21 (large payload single item) cover performance-related aspects.
Security: TC14 explicitly tests for SQL injection in field values.
gaps: Partial Update semantics: PUT does not explicitly test rejecting partial updates vs. replacing full payload (gap relative to Partial Update guideline).
Concurrency testing: no explicit race-condition/concurrent-update tests for simultaneous PUTs on the same item (gap).
Rate limiting: no tests addressing throttling or burst request handling (gap).
Caching behavior: no tests validating ETag/Cache-Control headers or caching behavior (gap).
Content-Type validation: explicit tests around content-type correctness (e.g., application/json) are not shown (gap).
Duplicate submissions beyond idempotency: no tests beyond basic idempotency coverage (gap).
Granular authorization scenarios: while 401 is tested, 403 for insufficient permissions is not explicitly covered (gap).
recommendations: Add explicit Partial Update vs. PATCH semantics test to verify PUT semantics, especially around updating only parts of the custom fields.
Introduce concurrency tests by simulating parallel PUT requests to the same invoice item to validate race conditions or proper locking/versioning.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests to ensure proper behavior under high request volume.
Add caching tests (ETag, Cache-Control) to validate caching behavior and freshness.
Add explicit Content-Type validation tests (ensuring requests fail gracefully for non-JSON bodies).
Extend authorization tests to cover 403 Forbidden scenarios for insufficient permissions, not just 401 Unauthorized.
Develop boundary tests for payload size across configurations to consistently trigger 413 or 204 outcomes as appropriate.
